settings.title: WhatsApp Bot Settings
settings.description: Configure your Meta WhatsApp Business API credentials here.
settings.access_token_hint: Generate this token in Meta Business Settings > System Users. It never expires.
settings.phone_id_hint: Found in Meta App > Use Cases > Customize > API Setup
settings.verify_token_hint: A secret string without spaces used to verify webhook requests from Meta (e.g. my_homey_token)
settings.webhook_url_hint: Copy this URL and paste it in the Meta Developer Portal as the Callback URL.
settings.error_verify_token_spaces: The Verify Token cannot contain spaces.
settings.guide_part1_step1: Go to developers.facebook.com and log in with your Facebook account.
settings.guide_part1_step2: Click My Apps (top right) then Create App.
settings.guide_part1_step3: In the Use Case section, select 'Connect with customers via WhatsApp'.
settings.guide_part1_step4: Link the app to a Business Portfolio (create one if needed — it's free).
settings.guide_part1_step5: Once the wizard finishes, go to Use Cases in the left menu and click Customize for WhatsApp.
settings.guide_part1_step6: Open API Setup on the left and note your Phone Number ID.
settings.guide_part2_step1: Go to business.facebook.com/settings and log in.
settings.guide_part2_step2: In the left menu under Users, click System Users then Add.
settings.guide_part2_step3: Name the user (e.g. HomeyBot), set role to Admin and click Create System User.
settings.guide_part2_step4: Click the three-dot menu (⋯) next to the user and select Assign Resources. Select your app, give Full Control and save.
settings.guide_part2_step5: Click Generate Token. Select the permissions 'whatsapp_business_messaging' and 'whatsapp_business_management'.
settings.guide_part2_step6: Copy the token immediately — it's shown only once. Paste it in the Access Token field above.
settings.guide_part3_step1: Go back to the Settings page and fill in the Access Token, Phone Number ID and Verify Token. Click Save Settings.
settings.guide_part3_step2: From the Settings page, copy your Webhook URL.
settings.guide_part3_step3: In your Meta App, go to WhatsApp > Configuration. Under Webhook, click Edit.
settings.guide_part3_step4: Paste the Webhook URL as Callback URL and your Verify Token, then click Verify and Save.
settings.guide_part3_step5: Click Manage next to Webhook Fields, find 'messages' and click Subscribe.
settings.guide_part4_step1: In your Meta App, go to WhatsApp > API Setup.
settings.guide_part4_step2: Generate a temporary token (top-right button). It expires in 24h and is only needed for this step.
settings.guide_part4_step3: In the 'To' dropdown, select your personal phone number (add and verify it if not present).
settings.guide_part4_step4: Click Send message. You will receive a WhatsApp message from the bot number.
settings.guide_part4_step5: Reply to that message from your phone. The bot is now active and saved in your contacts!
